head.title: The Right to Die With Dignity

hedline.hl1: The Right to Die With Dignity

block.p: Re ''A Ban on Assisted Suicide'' (editorial, Sept. 19):
Re ''A Ban on Assisted Suicide'' (editorial, Sept. 19):

Contrary to your editorial, the Pain Relief Promotion Act seeks not to discourage but to encourage appropriate use of federally regulated drugs to control the pain of terminally ill patients. Its overall design and specific provisions are quite clear in promoting pain management and palliative care for those who are dying.
The bill is endorsed by the American Medical Association, among others.

Our terminally ill friends and family members do not need assistance in dying; they need assistance in living, relief from pain and suffering, and the genuine freedom to die a natural death with dignity.
JOHN M. KERRY Executive Director New York State Catholic Conference Albany, Sept. 19, 2000
